entries.title: NASA and NOAA find 2022 was one of the hottest years on record
entries.description: The planet had one of its hottest years on record in 2022, as ocean heat soared and sea ice coverage in Antarctica melted to near-record lows.

entries.title: What's behind the violence, protests in Peru?
entries.description: At least 40 people have died in clashes between Peruvian security forces and protesters in the Andean country’s worst outbreak of violence in over 20 years, as

entries.title: Russia releases U.S. Navy veteran into Poland
entries.description: Russia on Thursday released a U.S. citizen who had crossed into its Kaliningrad exclave in the first weeks of Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine last February,

entries.title: Mexico tribunal: Buck-toothed cartoon president is an 'electoral violation'
entries.description: A buck-toothed cartoon version of Mexico’s president Andrés Manuel López Obrador constitutes an “electoral violation,” the country’s electoral tribunal ruled.

entries.title: Seven of Andrew Tate's houses were searched by Romanian authorities amid rape and trafficking investigation
entries.description: Romania’s anti-organized crime agency has carried out seven additional house searches in its investigation into divisive social media influencer Andrew Tate.

entries.title: Putin appoints new military commander in Ukraine amid new Russian offensive
entries.description: Ukraine is preparing for a major Russian offensive after President Putin appointed General Valery Gerasimov to lead the “special military operation” in Ukraine, replacing the previous commander after just three months. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports from Kyiv.

entries.title: Former top legal officials oppose judicial overhaul in Israel
entries.description: Former top legal officials in Israel spoke out Thursday against sweeping changes to the country’s justice system planned by the new conservative government,

entries.title: Mercenary chief rises with push in eastern Ukraine — and clashes with Russia's military leaders
entries.description: The head of a Russian mercenary group is emerging from the shadows to challenge Moscow’s ruling establishment, using battlefield success in Ukraine to burnish

entries.title: Satellite images hint at Covid outbreak’s true toll in China
entries.description: Satellite images taken over cities in China show long lines of vehicles at crematoriums and funeral homes, contradicting the low official Covid-19 death toll.

entries.title: Trump discussed using a nuclear weapon on North Korea in 2017 and blaming it on someone else, book says
entries.description: President Donald Trump discussed the idea of using a nuclear weapon against North Korea and suggested he could blame a U.S. strike on another country.

entries.title: Watch: Train car consumed by smoke on Mexico City metro
entries.description: A carriage on Mexico City's metro system caught fire on Wednesday, the latest incident in the capital's train network. According to reports, commuters disembarked from the train and no injuries were reported.

entries.title: “Lord of the Dance” Flatley treated for “aggressive” form of cancer
entries.description: Irish-American dancer Michael Flatley has undergone surgery for an “aggressive” form of cancer and is under medical care, a statement on the “Lord of the Dance”

entries.title: Video shows Ukrainian mortar team targeting Russian positions near Bakhmut
entries.description: Soldiers from the 28th Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces engaged Russian positions on the front line near Bakhmut in the Donetsk region.

entries.title: Brazil ‘mega-protest’ fizzles amid authorities’ concern
entries.description: Skittish Brazilian authorities on Wednesday spared no effort to boost security in the face of a social media flyer promoting a “mega-protest to retake power”

entries.title: Prince Harry’s memoir opens at a record-setting sales pace
entries.description: No, the public has not tired of hearing about Prince Harry. Sales for “Spare” have placed the Duke of Sussex in some rarefied company.

entries.title: U.S. and Japan agree to strengthen alliance to counter threats from China, North Korea
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with their Japanese counterparts to unveil a plan to strengthen the alliance between the U.S. and Japan amid threats from China and North Korea. The leaders also condemned China's destabilizing actions in the Indo-Pacific and North Korea’s ballistic missile testing.

entries.title: U.S. and Japan agree to strengthen alliance, citing China and North Korea
entries.description: The United States and Japan unveiled plans Wednesday to strengthen their alliance to help counter threats from North Korea and China.

entries.title: Russia claims first battlefield breakthrough in months
entries.description: Russian oligarch Yevgeny Prigozhin claimed his private army had taken control of the city of Soledar in eastern Ukraine, which Ukraine disputed. If true, it would mark a rare Russian victory after months of defeat. NBC News’ Matt Bradley has more details on the ongoing conflict.
